author: Special Correspondent
text:
An exclusive election cell to guide the public to lodge complaints on violation of Model Code of Conduct (MCC) and coordinate election work with the Election Commission and the office of Director General of Police has been established at the police headquarters here.

Headed by T. Inbamani, Additional Superintendent of Police (Headquarters), the cell would help and guide voters, political parties and candidates seeking election in the May 16 Assembly elections besides coordinating with the election officials, Superintendent of Police N Manivannan said.

As the Election Commission insisted that political parties should seek permission online for holding election rallies and public also could file complaints on violation of MCC through online, the cell would be of great help to coordinate with concerned officials and ensure that the elections were held in a free and fair manner, the SP said.

Public and political parties could access the election authorities through website www.elections.tn.gov.in for seeking permission and lodging complaints.

They could call the district election cell through toll free numbers of 044-232242, 9677755262 and 9443733118, A. D. Mohan Raj, Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) at the cell said.

An Inspector of police, two Sub Inspectors of Police and nine others would be available round-the-clock to answer public queries on election related issues, he said. Public could lodge complaints by visiting private browsing centres and e-service centres run by the Tamil Nadu Cable Tv Corporation, he added.
title: Exclusive election cell set up in Ramanathapuram
